roleset.name: gov't coopting private property
roleset.note: NATIONALIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'nationalize' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from nationalize.01-v predicate notes)
NATIONALIZATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, nationalize-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls other_cos-45.4. (from nationalization.01-n)

example.name: active
example.text: A long succession of Mexican presidents arbitrarily nationalized whatever industry they took a fancy to, without having to answer to the public.
example.arg: A long succession of Mexican presidents
whatever industry they took a fancy to
without having to answer to the public

example.name: passive
example.text: Despite fears [the mine]-2 may be partially nationalized [*-2]by the new Namibian government following next month's elections freeing the country from South African control, De Beers engineers are working to extend the mine's productive life for another 25 years, from the current estimate of 10.
example.arg: following next month's elections freeing the country from South African control

example.name: Both args
example.text: the Japanese government has already completed signing the landowner's contract, and formalized their nationalization of the Diaoyu Islands
